remarks.para: May be inoperative in latched position provided override mechanism is verified to be operative.

numlitem.para: Push landing gear LOCK OVRD switch.
Position landing gear lever to UP.
After GEAR light extinguishes, position landing gear lever to OFF.

placard.para: Placard near Landing Gear Lever "LATCH SOLENOID INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Make sure the following circuit breakers on P11 panel are closed:
C30, LANDING GEAR POS SYS 1
S23, LANDING GEAR POS SYS 2
A35, IND LIGHTS 4
P28, R IND LTS 1
S20, LEVER LOCK
Complete the following to verify the LOCK OVRD button is operative:

warning.para: make sure the downlocks are installed in all of the landing gear before moving the control lever. without the downlocks, the landing gear can retract and cause injuries to persons and damage to equipment.

numlitem.para: Install the downlocks for the nose and main landing gear (AMM 32-00-20/201).
Supply electrical power (AMM 24-22-00/201).

warning.para: make sure the main and nose landing gear areas are clear of persons and equipment before you do this test. the landing gear doors open and close quickly and can cause injury to persons or damage to equipment.

numlitem.para: Pressurize the left hydraulic system (AMM 29-11-00/201).
Open LEVER LOCK circuit breaker (S20) on the overhead circuit breaker panel, P11, and attach DO-NOT-CLOSE identifier.
Make sure the LANDING GEAR lever cannot be moved to UP without the LEVER LOCK override button pushed in. Push the LEVER LOCK override button and make sure the LANDING GEAR lever will move to UP.
Move the LANDING GEAR lever to DN. Make sure the green NOSE, LEFT, and RIGHT lights on the panel P3-1 are on.
Make sure the LEVER LOCK circuit breaker (S20) on the overhead circuit breaker panel, P11, is closed.
Remove the pressure from the left hydraulic system if no longer necessary.
Remove the downlocks from the nose and main landing gears if no longer necessary.
Restore aircraft to its required configuration.
